issue.title: PostingList API Count() Error in calculation

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

body:
Thanks @heidawei !

So, trying an example to make sure I understand.

Let's say I have 100 doc in my index, but only 5 docs have the term "hello".  So, the postings bitmap for "hello" would have 5 bits turned on (cardinality 5).

Then, let's say I delete 40 docs, but I carefully delete 40 completely different docs than those 5 hello docs. 

So the cardinality in the "except" bitmap would be 40.

But, the count would be incorrect since 5 - 40 ==> zero... when, instead the count for the postings-list for "hello" should still be 5.

Great catch!  Thanks!
That makes sense @steveyen but doesn't the 1-hit encoded case also need to account for that doc being deleted?  That part was lost when the `e` calculation moved into the else if.
Indeed -- the 1-hit encoding case also needs a similar maneuver.

I'm thinking a potential solution in the 1-hit case is that we'd need to check to see if the 1-hit docNum is in the except bitmap and return a count of 1 or 0 accordingly.  Might be other edge situations I'm not thinking of here.
@steveyen yes I agree, but I forgot how(if?) we know what that one hit is at this level, or if it was up-stairs and thus making this harder to fix...  I think it was late and I just closed the tab :)

> ... but I forgot how(if?) ...

This describes me on every Monday morning!! :-)

Taking a look again, I'm thinking the PostingsList itself has enough info or state to know that it's in 1-bit mode, and also knows the exact doc-num when it's in 1-bit mode...

https://github.com/blevesearch/bleve/blob/master/index/scorch/segment/zap/posting.go#L110
yah, that looks right to me

issue.title: fix postings list count implementation

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
previously the calculation subtracted the total number of
deleted documents, without regard for how the deleted documents
set might overlap with the postings list, this was incorrect.

fixes #1140
